p: Clinical laboratory findings suggested leucopenia (white blood cell count less than 2.91 × 10 9/l) and lymphopenia (lymphocyte count less than 1.0 × 10 9/l), high erythrocyte sedimentation rate, altered myocardial zymogram with elevated levels of lactate dehydrogenase and creatinine kinase, increased levels of alanine aminotransferase or aspartate aminotransferase as indicators of irregular liver function, a rise in hypersensitive troponin I (hs-cTnI) as a sign of virus-induced heart tissue damage, and a marked increase in the concentration of serum C-reactive protein and D-dimer, hyperbilirubinemia, and acidosis [ 3, 24].
